title: Document that WebApplicationInitializers are not supported when using an embedded container
Load application properties in ../conf/
body:
In order to ship Spring Boot apps as classic "posix" tar.gz archives, it would be cool if  Spring Boot picked-up application properties files in `../conf/`.

    .
    ├── bin -> application.jar 
    └── conf -> application.properties, logback-spring.xml...

PR #4641

title: Load application.properties/.yaml from ../conf/
body:
Load application properties from ../conf to allow "standard" linux tar.gz packaging

 * Add ../conf/ to default search locations (last)
 * Update docs

title: setting registerShutDownHook on SpringApplication/Builder does not work as expected
spring-boot-gradle-plugin: Do not add findMainClass dependency to each JavaExec task
Embedded/NonEmbedded DataSourceAutoConfiguration is confusing
body:
In `DataSourceAutoConfiguration` we have two mutually exclusive conditions that check the presence of a connection pool. If a connection pool is found, we run in the "non embedded" scenario. But the tomcat connection pool can provide a connection to H2 (which is embedded).

In the end the auto-configuration report shows that we run in non embedded mode (while the underlying data source is embedded). We should probably rename these conditions.

title: Custom ServerProperties not bound to application.properties
body: If the user provides a `@Bean` of type `ServerProperties` he might expect it to be bound to the application.properties (so the port can be changed for instance). This isn't working in 1.3 because we grab the `ServerProperties` in a `Condition` (before even the `Environment` is injectable).

title: Embedded Mongo: windows firewall problem - bindIp property should be changable
Move ApplicationEventPublisherAware implementation to abstract audit listeners
body:
While adopting our project to changes from #4406, some room for further improvements was noticed.

Since newly created abstract audit listener classes implement ```ApplicationEventPublisherAware```, ```ApplicationEventPublisher``` related code could safely be moved from implementation to abstract audit listener classes. IMO this would also make those classes more useful.

I've signed the CLA.

title: Sometimes jar built by spring-boot maven plugin is not working correctly
body:
Depending on path of project directory jar build with spring-boot-maven plugin from same sources is working correctly or throws exception.
Same project in two different directories is either producing correct jar or wrong jar.
On different computers same project is working either correctly or incorrectly in various dirs.
When we add new Bean sometimes correct jar is produced everywhere (we weren't able to find rule).
On dropbox we have example virtual machine with same project in two dirs (/tmp/core/geri1 and /tmp/core/SpringBootProject). In geri1 directory project is producing wrong jar, in SpringBootProject dir jar is correctly built.

Links to vm (created with kvm): 
disk: https://www.dropbox.com/s/itw8s787zjrjoqz/dev_compressed.qcow2?dl=0
conf: https://www.dropbox.com/s/330v9fc4648ydhy/spring.xml?dl=0
root passwd: 12345678
When jar is correct application start without any execption. When jar is wrong Exception is thrown.

title: Use start-stop-daemon only if all options are supported
body:
Depending on the existence of start-stop-daemon isn't enough, as several options are not supported by older versions. The first version shipped by dpkg that consumes all options used here is 1.16.5 (--no-close has been introduced in dpkgs repository with commit 3de1552).

SLES11 is shipping start-stop-daemon in version 0.3.1 as part of the package sysvinit:
```
start-stop-daemon --help
start-stop-daemon for Debian Linux - small and fast C version written by
Marek Michalkiewicz <marekm@i17linuxb.ists.pwr.wroc.pl>, public domain.
version 0.3.1, 1996-07-19

Usage:
    start-stop-daemon -S|--start options ... -- arguments ...
    start-stop-daemon -K|--stop options ...
    start-stop-daemon -H|--help
    start-stop-daemon -V|--version

Options (at least one of --exec|--pidfile|--user is required):
    -x|--exec <executable>       program to start/check if it is running
    -p|--pidfile <pid-file>      pid file to check
    -u|--user <username>|<uid>   stop this user's processes
    -n|--name <process-name>     start/stop processes with this name
    -s|--signal <signal>         signal to send (default 15)
    -t|--test                    test mode, don't do anything
    -o|--oknodo                  exit status 0 (not 1) if nothing done
    -q|--quiet  |  -v, --verbose

Exit status:  0 = done  1 = nothing done (=> 0 if --oknodo)  2 = trouble
```

title: Possibility to disable hypermedia for actuator endpoints
body:
It would be nice if it was possible to disable the hypermedia feature for the actuator endpoints.

Currently this behavior is implemented by 
EndpointWebMvcHypermediaManagementContextConfiguration.MvcEndpointAdvice, and I couldn't find a possibility to disable only this advice. 

I have hateoas in the classpath (because of swagger) and like the /actuator endpoint, but not the modified output of the other actuator endpoints. Not all clients can work with the new output.

Or did I miss something?

title: Invalid regex RelaxedNames.Manipulation#CAMELCASE_TO_UNDERSCORE
body:
IntelliJ IDEA is using `RelaxedNames.Manipulation#CAMELCASE_TO_UNDERSCORE` and managed to get the following exception

```
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Illegal group reference
	at java.util.regex.Matcher.appendReplacement(Matcher.java:857)
```

I don't have more details but we should double check that regexp.
